Transcribed text: overwhelming and straight up confusing here's your guide to starting in the gym and doing your best to stay consistent let's start off with something that's personal to you your goals in the gym we can go down so many different parts be it CrossFit powerlifting or even my forte bodybuilding whatever your goals you should develop a general idea of what it is you want to achieve in the gym this will ensure that you're happy in the gym doing what you love and something that you really should know that your goals may change over time the gym you choose should be environment that you're comfortable with un fortunately there should be a lot of options available from commercial gyms to various included private gyms to even the most hardcore gyms you need to visit a gym that you feel comfortably in and just check it out most commercial gyms offer a tour or 3-day pass to check them out now that you have these two things under the belt let's get you prepared for the gym if you have no history in the gym what I would suggest is doing some research online or watch some YouTube videos of others working out it may seem a little bit weird but it's a great way for you to develop an understanding of the different machines and it's also a great way to see the different movements this brings me on to the next step of preparation developing your workout routine or split now again this is going to entirely depend on your goals and my forte is bodybuilding so we're going to use bodybuilding as a reference for most beginners I suggest starting on a lower and upper split now you're probably wondering what that means it essentially means you're going to be dividing the days you're working out by either upper or lower body and here's some examples examples of it now this usually works very well for beginners but if it's not enough The Next Step I suggest is PPL which means Push Pull legs all synergestic muscle groups are work together meaning on push days when you train your chest your shoulders are activated with your triceps and you work your shoulders your chest and triceps are activated as well this is a great way to develop good mind muscle connection which helps with strength muscle growth and a good understanding of your body here are some examples of PPL now that you got your plan let's talk about your first day depending on how anxious you feel about working out around others I'd suggest go at a time with you feel comfortable gyms are generally less busy around 10: to 2:00 p.m. and from 7:00 p.m. to closing time so now you're at the gym doing your first exercises don't worry about what weight you use even if you put it on the lightest weight and simply just feel how the machines feel and you can do this for however how long you need until you feel comfortable now when you're ready increase the weight slightly then go for around 10 to 12 Reps for four sets each do this for each and every exercise and then you can move on reps meaning the amount of times you do a single movement of an exercise sets being the number of times that you do the group of repetitions now there's a few things I want you to remember on day one the gym is a place we should all feel comfortable all the people in the gym have been in the same position that you are just starting out and they understand what it feels to be in that position if you feel more comfortable being in the gym with someone else it's a great way to start out too speak to a friend colleague or family member and see if they're willing to start on this journey with you so sometimes going by now when you're moving forward in your journey now you're probably asking how do I stay motivated how do I keep going to the gym even if I don't feel like it one thing you have to remember is that the gym is a lifestyle change it's a slow and beautiful process that you should enjoy remind yourself of why you're doing this it's a time for you to focus on yourself but nonetheless establishing the gym into your routine is a great way to stay consistent go every day at the same time and even on the days you don't feel like it give yourself the opportunity and still go even if you don't give 100% something is still better than nothing that consistency is going to make it easier over time and ingrain it into your lifestyle the gym will truly change your life and if you feel this video helped

Transcribed text: the settlers of catan how to play the object of the game is to be the first person to have 10 victory points you receive one victory point for each settlement you have and two victory points for each city you have if you control the longest road you receive two points and the largest army gives you two as well finally some development cards are worth victory points to set up shuffle the land hexes and evenly distribute them on the table in the shape of a hexagon next place the water ports around the board every other hex making sure the numbers point towards the longest series of land tiles fill in the gaps with blank water hexes next starting at the corner of the board place the numbered tokens on this terrain hexes in alphabetical order proceeding counterclockwise towards the center skipping the desert place the robber token on the desert separate the five different types of resource cards brick or wool lumber and grain and place them face up on the table shuffle the development cards in place facedown on the table everyone chooses a color and takes the corresponding pieces roll dice the highest number goes first players take one turn placing one settlement on any available hex intersection and one adjoining road settlements may not be placed adjacent to another settlement after each player has placed one settlement and road then starting with the last player and going in reverse order players place one more settlement and one more adjoining road after you play your second settlement and road take one resource card for each resource that that settlement is touching the desert and water do not produce resources once every player has placed their second starting settlement and road then the game begins with the starting player and continues clockwise until there is a winner on your turn before you can buy or trade you must roll both dice then based on what number is rolled the corresponding resource hex that has that number produces its resource to all players who have a settlement or city touching that hex you receive one of the resources of that hex for every settlement touching it and you receive 2 of the resource of that hex for every city touching it there is no hand size limit however if any player including you rolls a 7 then any player with more than 7 cards must discard half of them down additionally whoever rolled the seven must move the robber to a different terrain Dex the robber may not be returned to the desert nor shall it be moved to a water hex whichever hex you choose place the robber covering the number on that hex showing that the terrain cannot produce resources when that number is rolled when the robber is moved if any other player has a city or settlement touching the affected hex you must pick one card at random from one of their hands and steal it you then continue your turn as normal after you roll dice and collect resources or move the robber you are allowed to trade with other players or the bank and/or buy things only the player whose turn it is can initialize a trade and you can only trade with other players who have resources you cannot gift resources a trade with a player is whatever you agree on but you cannot trade development cards and like resources both players have to agree on the trade additionally on your turn you may trade with the bank for of one resource for one of any other if you own a settlement or city that is touching a port on your turn you are allowed to trade with that port specifics three-two-one ports allow you to trade three of one resource for one of any other two to one ports allow you to trade two of one very specific resource as indicated by that port for one of any other you don't have to trade if you don't want to you may also buy during your turn pay the bank the proper resources and you can buy roads settlement cities and development cards roads cost one brick and one wood and must be placed between two hexes connecting to one of your existing pieces so long as a road isn't already present if you have the longest continuous road and it is greater than five pieces then you take possession of the longest Road card no matter who has it the longest road is worth two victory points a settlement must be placed on an available intersection connecting to one of your roads no settlement may be adjacent to another settlement or city you may only upgrade one of your existing settlements into a city remove that settlement and replace it with the city anytime during your turn even before you roll you may play a development card you may not use the development card the turn you purchased it you may only play one development card per turn unless it is a victory point then you may reveal as many as you have to allow you to win all the cards say what they do the most common card is the soldier the soldier allows you to move the robber to another space when you play a soldier it plays in front of you and stays there for the rest of the game when it is played in X just like you roll the 7 except it does not affect the number of cards in player's hands if you have the most soldiers in play and that number is greater than 3 then you take control of the largest army card which is worth two victory points if you cannot buy or trade or you choose not to your turn ends and the next player clockwise goes play continues until one person has ten or more victory points on their turn then that player is the winner

Transcribed text: War Thunder is a very very bad game to get into there are basically no useful tutorials the UI is cluttered to an insane extend there's too many nations to pick from the economy's terrible and the grind long here are 10 tips that I wish I knew before starting the game tip number One never and I mean never buy silver lines of golden eagles I know it looks like a good deal you get 1.3 million silver lines for 3000 GE and is a total beginner that might seem enticing but please get a premium vehicle instead they are much longer lasting Investments and give you back much more in terms of civil lines and research in the grand scheme of the War Thunder grind 1.3 million is not a lot also don't buy research points with Gold Eagles for the exact same reasons tip number two Don't Buy Low tier premium Vehicles unless you are a big fan of this specific vehicle or plan on playing this VR range a lot there is no point in buying low tier premiums since they are low tiers they give pretty terrible rewards compared to Mid and high tier premiums and they can't really help you grind through the tree sure Rank 2 Premium will allow you to grind faster for rank 1 to 3 but that is actually the easiest part of the grind for some tech trees the entirety of their ranked one and two research is only as much as a single high tier vehicle save up your GE to buy something of a higher rank so it actually helps you tip number three before you buy those High tier premiums watch some tutorials about mechanics of higher tier gameplay a lot of the mechanics you need for high tier plane or tank are explained nowhere and oftentimes don't even have the keybind setup one example of this is radar controls for High T aircraft or thermocytes and Laser rangefinders for tanks you will have a hard time adjusting to the more modern types of vehicles don't make it even harder on yourself by not being prepared tip number four just don't play Naval I mean do I even need to explain this one unless you use a premium boat for Save Alliance farming just play literally anything else watching a 10 hour YouTube video of white noise is probably more interesting tip number five wait for sales before buying Premium Time generally it's a great idea to always wait for the regular sales before buying anything even vehicles but I can understand that people don't want to wait one year until the new height premium is on sale but for premium time you should always wait for a sale a 50 off sale for one year or even 180 days is a great discount and easily lasts you until the next sale tip number six don't buy anything in-game if you're using steam for War Thunder if you only use War Thunder's launcher it's fine but if you're using the steam version like me you are potentially losing unnecessary money when buying certain things in War Thunder this is because steam asks for a certain amount of every purchase you make in games that are offered on Steam and Gaijin decided that it is the best idea to give this extra cost directly to their customers as an example the biggest Golden Eagle pack costs 165 bucks in the steam version while it only costs 114 in their Standalone version you can get around this by simply buying golden eagles and other things on gaijin's website where even steam users will get a fair pricing tip number seven always level up your cruise after a long session of grinding I sometimes have thousands of crew experience points that I forgot to invest this is literally kneecapping your performance as these screws can give you big bony to things like reload speed tour Traverse speed crew survivability and tank repair speed don't forget to do this on a regular basis tip number eight joining a squadron is necessary if you want to unlock certain Vehicles without spending real world money it is important that you do this as early in your War Thunder career as possible if you need to find a good Squadron join my Discord ask me directly to make space for you in my personal Squadron it's very active so you can be sure to earn those Squadron research points the link to my Discord is in the video description and in the pinned comment tip number nine stay informed about events you can earn quite powerful and relatively high-ranking vehicles that are in the regular summer and winter events and they will cost nothing to unlock if you don't want to keep them you can oftentimes sell them for Gaijin coin on the market which can be spent to get golden eagles or other event Vehicles this is an easy way to quickly get access to high-ranking Vehicles tip number 10 use your boosters oftentimes when I get a silver line or research point booster I tend to forget about them and miss out on earning more rewards for free many people are also hesitant to use their boosters in fear of Performing bad in the next game and the booster going to waste in my opinion Don don't be scared and just always use them even if you activate a booster and perform bad in the next game over the span of many days and many boosters it will eventually average out don't worry about those few bad times as the saying goes you win some you lose some that's it for today's video and thank you for watching
label: non-well-being

Transcribed text:
hello summoners and welcome back to another pro guys video my name is saskio and today we'll be going over the abilities of the newest league champion vexx as always anything on the pbe is subject to change but let's talk about everything we know so far unlike auction vex has a surprisingly small amount of text in her ability description for a champion released in season 11. but looking at gwen you don't need a lot of words to be a strong champion now let's jump into her kit vex's passive is called doom and glow the first part doom periodically empowers vex's basic abilities to interrupt dashes and fear enemies the second part of her passive gloom marks enemies that use a dash or blink with gloom vex's next basic attack against a marked enemy detonates the mark dealing bonus damage and refunding a part of doom's cooldown this passive is a core part of vex's identity being able to interrupt dashes and fear enemies with a basic ability is really powerful especially since it gives you cc on any of your other skills when vex is glowing green you better be careful the second part literally just gives you free damage and depending on the numbers and cooldown reduction vex might get her enhanced abilities very quickly if she's facing someone mobile like irelia or even yasuo before we talk about the rest
called mistral bolt she launches a wave forward dealing magic damage to enemies it passes through after a short delay the wave accelerates but has a reduced width mistral bull also detonates gloom on any marked enemies that it hits like most champions vex's q will be her bread and butter ability the speed and timing is really interesting and it'll probably surprise players during the first few weeks of release because her q can proc the extra damage from her passive it's crucial that you land this on as many people as possible so you aren't overlapping your glue marks moving on to vex's w personal space this ability is really good on a squishy mage when used vex gains a shield and emits a shock wave dealing magic damage to enemies around her personal space also detonates gloom on any marked champions this w is a really solid ability for peeling both herself and her teeth because her doom passive recharges over time in the mid and late game vex will almost always have her fear up just in case she gets caught out having an instant fear and shield is great on any champion and being able to proc her gloom mark makes a simple ability even more powerful alright let's talk about her e looming darkness vex says shadow flies to a location increasing in size as it travels on arriving shadow deals magic damage slows and marks enemies hit with gloom i'd say another normal looking ability something important to note here is that vex's e actually applies a mark of gloom instead of consuming it if you want to maximize your damage it's crucial that you don't overlap your marks luckily this ability has a pretty decent travel time so you should be able to weave in an auto attack to trigger your gloom before applying it again now let's talk about everyone's favorite part the ultimate vex's r is called shadow surge shadows fly forward marking and dealing magic damage to the first enemy champion hit vex can then recast his abilities have shadow pull her to the marked target dealing additional magic damage if the marked target dies within a short time of taking damage from shadow surge vex can cast shadow surge again within a few seconds on paper this ability reminds me of an ultimate version of the snowball from aram one important thing to know is that you can only get the reset if you kill an enemy shortly after they take damage from the ultimate if you get a random assist while your else is on cooldown it won't reset my favorite part about this ability that works really well with the rest of vex's kit you can jump in on any champion that needs to w for a huge aoe fear or you can try to wait until you see an enemy get low to chase down the kill speaking of vex's kit let's talk about our first impressions vex is a breath of fresh air in terms of both champion design and abilities she's the first female yordle we've gotten in almost 10 years and her abilities aren't walls of text either the cool thing about vex is that unless her numbers are just insane her power will change depending on the enemy team if the enemy team has no dashes or blinks you actually lose a pretty big chunk of your damage because you won't get a lot of glue marks less glue marks mean you won't be able to reduce the cooldown of your fear which will leave you dealing less damage and having less cc but honestly i think that's totally fine vex's e still applies gloom and let's be honest i can't name the last game of league of legends that didn't have a champion with a dash even if the enemy has 5 champions with dashes maximizing your damage is going to be a lot of work juggling your empowered auto attacks with your q and w will give vex a ton of damage if done correctly so let's see what the best players can come up with and that's everything we've got
you
label: non-well-being
